attributes.action: Allow hospitals to give morbidly obese patients the help they need
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Hospitals used to be able to put morbidly obese patients on a restricted calorie diet- in order to allow them to benefit from significant weight loss during their hospital stay (in which time the patients calorific needs are reduced anyway- since they are confined to a hospital bed).

They are now required to provide all patients with food of the same calorie content. 

Re-legislation on this issue would allow hospitals to help morbidly obese patients to regain their mobility, reduce their dependency and improve their overall health.
